thread.title: Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez drop collaborative song 'Strong'
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez drop collaborative song 'Strong' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez drop collaborative song 'Strong'
text:
AFP/AFP/Getty Images Singers Selena Gomez and Justin Bieber arrive at the American Music Awards, in Los Angeles, California, on November 20, 2011. AFP PHOTO/VALERIE MACON (Photo credit should read VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images) Famous exes Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez got back together - for a new song, at least.
The former lovers stunned fans on Saturday night when they dropped an unexpected collaboration entitled "Strong" - in which they appear to address their tumultuous past relationship.
"You're the only one I'm really missing," Bieber sings. "Nobody else would be forgiving, cause of all the love that you give me."
Gomez then responds to her former flame, singing: "Wishing I was better at this damn thing, cause it's just been too long and I can't change."
justinbieber via Instagram Justin Bieber posts photo to Instagram of Selena Gomez and himself on Wednesday, August 27, 2014. The two stars' highly publicized relationship began in 2010 when they were both teenagers, and they dated on-and-off until early last year.
Last month, Gomez told Elle magazine that she still considers Bieber a "genuinely" good friend, adding that she didn't know if they would ever get back together.
"I'll forever support him and love him in a way," Gomez told the magazine. "We grew up together."
justinbieber via Instagram Justin Bieber posted an Instagram on October 6, 2014 of Selena Gomez kissing his arm. Two weeks later, Bieber, 21, admitted to Complex that the two singers were so deeply in love that he struggled to have his own identity while they were together.
"We were so in love. Nothing else mattered," he told the magazine. "We were all about each other. But when it's like that and you get your value from that, people will always disappoint you. Your girl or your dude, they're always going to disappoint you."
It's unknown if the duo's surprising new track will be featured on Bieber's new album, "Purpose," which is set to be released on Nov. 13.
Gomez, meanwhile, released a new album of her own, titled "Revival," earlier this month.
